description.plain:
j-hope (제이홉) was born as Jung Hoseok (정호석) on February 18, 1994, in Gwangju, South Korea. He’s a dancer, rapper, songwriter, composer and producer. He’s also known as a member of the South Korean group BTS.

Before debuting with BTS, Hoseok was part of the underground street dance team Neuron. In 2008 he won a national dance competition in South Korea.

In 2010 he joined Big Hit Entertainment as a trainee and debuted with BTS in 2013.

Hoseok has a bright disposition, and is known to be the mood lifter in the group. To create his stage name, he took the ‘J’ from his surname, and the ‘H’ from his given name. He stated in an interview:

My stage name has the deepest meaning out of all the others in this group. (laughs) You know how in Pandora’s Box after everything else left, the only thing remaining was hope, right? I put ‘hope’ in my name to be a hopeful presence in the group.

In 2018, he released his first solo mixtape, Hope World. The album was met with a positive reception and made him the highest-charting Korean solo act on Billboard 200 (the title previously held by his bandmate–RM). The album has reached #1 on iTunes in 102 countries and is the most streamed album by Korean solo artists on Spotify.

On September 27, 2019, he released his hit song “Chicken Noodle Soup” featuring Becky G. The song has reached #1 on iTunes in 100 countries.

In 2018, along with the other members of BTS, he was awarded the fifth-class Hwagwan Order of Cultural Merit by the President of South Korea for the contribution to Korean culture.

In January 2020, Hoseok was promoted to a full member of the Korea Music Copyright Association (KOMCA). As for 2020, j-hope is credited officially as a writer/producer of over 100 tracks on KOMCA.

In September 2020, alongside with the other members of BTS, j-hope has spoken at the United Nations General Assembly about the hope in times of pandemic.

Later in 2020, j-hope, alongside with SUGA, become the first Koreans to write  and compose a #1 Billboard Hot 100 song.

songs.title: Daydream (백일몽)

description.plain:
Daydream is J-hope’s second single released on March 1st 2018, following 1 Verse released in 2015. Daydream came out as a music video on Big Hit Entertainment’s Youtube channel, ibighit. Along with Daydream, the rest of ‘Hope World’ was released on Itunes/Apple Music, Spotify, and Soundcloud.  The music video depicts J-Hope in a daydream and surrounding him is all things he wishes to do. He is seen not worrying about anything although he knows his dream won’t last forever.

Many people say the video reminds them of the artist Andy Warhol’s work, while some parts have a very old-school feel through the text, colors, and apparel.

songs.full_title: Chicken Noodle Soup by ​j-hope (Ft. Becky G.)
songs.title: Chicken Noodle Soup

description.plain:
“Chicken Noodle Soup” is a collaboration between Latin-American artist Becky G and j-hope, member of Korean boy group BTS, interpolating a mutual “favorite childhood song”. Naver reports it charted #1 in 69 countries on Apple Music upon release.

It interpolates the classic 2006 hit song “Chicken Noodle Soup” by Webstar and Young B (feat. AG aka The Voice of Harlem). j-hope says the song’s accompanying dance is one of the first songs that helped him realize his passion for it.

The song is a celebration of global diversity and culture, showing pride in where they came from. They rap and sing about their homes and how they got to be where they are now. In this track, they bring three languages together. They both connect on a classic African-American hip-hop song.

The music video seconds this: it features j-hope and Becky G alongside more than 50 culturally-diverse dancers to showcase an explosive, sharp-set choreography.

songs.embed_content: Read “Chicken Noodle Soup” by ​j-hope on Genius
songs.recording_location: Larrabee Sound Studios, North Hollywood, CA
